trans-unit.source: Begins an asynchronous operation to upload a single block.
trans-unit.target: Begins an asynchronous operation to upload a single block.

trans-unit.source: A Base64-encoded string that identifies the block.
trans-unit.target: A Base64-encoded string that identifies the block.

trans-unit.source: A <codeEntityReference>T:System.IO.Stream</codeEntityReference> object that provides the data for the block.
trans-unit.target: A <codeEntityReference>T:System.IO.Stream</codeEntityReference> object that provides the data for the block.

trans-unit.source: An optional hash value used to ensure transactional integrity for the block.
trans-unit.target: An optional hash value used to ensure transactional integrity for the block.

trans-unit.source: May be <codeInline>null</codeInline> or an empty string.
trans-unit.target: May be <codeInline>null</codeInline> or an empty string.

trans-unit.source: An <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Storage.AccessCondition</codeEntityReference> object that represents the condition that must be met in order for the request to proceed.
trans-unit.target: An <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Storage.AccessCondition</codeEntityReference> object that represents the condition that must be met in order for the request to proceed.

trans-unit.source: If <codeInline>null</codeInline>, no condition is used.
trans-unit.target: If <codeInline>null</codeInline>, no condition is used.

trans-unit.source: A <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Storage.Blob.BlobRequestOptions</codeEntityReference> object that specifies additional options for the request.
trans-unit.target: A <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Storage.Blob.BlobRequestOptions</codeEntityReference> object that specifies additional options for the request.

trans-unit.source: An <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Storage.OperationContext</codeEntityReference> object that represents the context for the current operation.
trans-unit.target: An <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Storage.OperationContext</codeEntityReference> object that represents the context for the current operation.

trans-unit.source: An <codeEntityReference>T:System.AsyncCallback</codeEntityReference> delegate that will receive notification when the asynchronous operation completes.
trans-unit.target: An <codeEntityReference>T:System.AsyncCallback</codeEntityReference> delegate that will receive notification when the asynchronous operation completes.

trans-unit.source: A user-defined object that will be passed to the callback delegate.
trans-unit.target: A user-defined object that will be passed to the callback delegate.

trans-unit.source: An <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Storage.ICancellableAsyncResult</codeEntityReference> that references the asynchronous operation.
trans-unit.target: An <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Storage.ICancellableAsyncResult</codeEntityReference> that references the asynchronous operation.

trans-unit.source: Clients may send the Content-MD5 header for a given Put Block operation as a means to ensure transactional integrity over the wire.
trans-unit.target: Clients may send the Content-MD5 header for a given Put Block operation as a means to ensure transactional integrity over the wire.

trans-unit.source: The <parameterReference>contentMD5</parameterReference> parameter permits clients who already have access to a pre-computed MD5 value for a given byte range to provide it.
trans-unit.target: The <parameterReference>contentMD5</parameterReference> parameter permits clients who already have access to a pre-computed MD5 value for a given byte range to provide it.

trans-unit.source: If the <codeEntityReference>P:BlobRequestOptions.UseTransactionalMd5</codeEntityReference> property is set to <codeInline>true</codeInline> and the <parameterReference>contentMD5</parameterReference> parameter is set to <codeInline>null</codeInline>, then the client library will calculate the MD5 value internally.
trans-unit.target: If the <codeEntityReference>P:BlobRequestOptions.UseTransactionalMd5</codeEntityReference> property is set to <codeInline>true</codeInline> and the <parameterReference>contentMD5</parameterReference> parameter is set to <codeInline>null</codeInline>, then the client library will calculate the MD5 value internally.

trans-unit.source: Begins an asynchronous operation to upload a single block.
trans-unit.target: Begins an asynchronous operation to upload a single block.

trans-unit.target: A Base64-encoded string that identifies the block.

trans-unit.source: A <codeEntityReference>T:System.IO.Stream</codeEntityReference> object that provides the data for the block.
trans-unit.target: A <codeEntityReference>T:System.IO.Stream</codeEntityReference> object that provides the data for the block.

trans-unit.source: An optional hash value used to ensure transactional integrity for the block.
trans-unit.target: An optional hash value used to ensure transactional integrity for the block.

trans-unit.source: May be <codeInline>null</codeInline> or an empty string.
trans-unit.target: May be <codeInline>null</codeInline> or an empty string.

trans-unit.target: An <codeEntityReference>T:System.AsyncCallback</codeEntityReference> delegate that will receive notification when the asynchronous operation completes.

trans-unit.source: A user-defined object that will be passed to the callback delegate.
trans-unit.target: A user-defined object that will be passed to the callback delegate.

trans-unit.source: An <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Storage.ICancellableAsyncResult</codeEntityReference> that references the asynchronous operation.
trans-unit.target: An <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Storage.ICancellableAsyncResult</codeEntityReference> that references the asynchronous operation.

trans-unit.source: Clients may send the Content-MD5 header for a given Put Block operation as a means to ensure transactional integrity over the wire.
trans-unit.target: Clients may send the Content-MD5 header for a given Put Block operation as a means to ensure transactional integrity over the wire.

trans-unit.source: The <parameterReference>contentMD5</parameterReference> parameter permits clients who already have access to a pre-computed MD5 value for a given byte range to provide it.
trans-unit.target: The <parameterReference>contentMD5</parameterReference> parameter permits clients who already have access to a pre-computed MD5 value for a given byte range to provide it.

trans-unit.source: If the <codeEntityReference>P:BlobRequestOptions.UseTransactionalMd5</codeEntityReference> property is set to <codeInline>true</codeInline> and the <parameterReference>contentMD5</parameterReference> parameter is set to <codeInline>null</codeInline>, then the client library will calculate the MD5 value internally.
trans-unit.target: If the <codeEntityReference>P:BlobRequestOptions.UseTransactionalMd5</codeEntityReference> property is set to <codeInline>true</codeInline> and the <parameterReference>contentMD5</parameterReference> parameter is set to <codeInline>null</codeInline>, then the client library will calculate the MD5 value internally.
